title: Vaporwave MIDI Player: Winamp-Style Music Experience
description: A complete vaporwave music player with Winamp aesthetic, featuring 22 MIDI tracks, 8 AI-generated album covers, 4 switchable skins, animated visualizer, and full playback controls. Built using vaporwave-glassomorphic-ui-designer skill for Windows 3.1 CRT aesthetic with pink/purple sunset gradients.

outcome.summary: Successfully created a fully functional vaporwave music player with Winamp aesthetic. Features 22 MIDI tracks, 8 AI-generated album covers, 4 theme skins, animated 24-bar visualizer, and comprehensive playback controls. Integrated into website navbar and modal interface.
learned: Vaporwave aesthetic requires specific color theory: pink/purple sunsets, CRT glow effects, retro typography
Winamp UI pattern translates well to modern React: title bar, display area, controls, equalizer/visualizer
MIDI playback in browser has limitations (no native support, requires soundfont.js or similar)
Skin system benefits from CSS variables for theme switching
Album cover generation with AI requires specific prompts for genre consistency
Persistent preferences enhance UX (localStorage for skin selection)
Windows 3.1 beveled border aesthetic: inset/outset borders with specific color palettes
Visualizer animation adds significant visual interest even with simple CSS transitions

narrative: Remember Winamp? That lime-green button that said "It really whips the llama's ass"? Now imagine it got drunk on pink sunsets, fell through a CRT monitor, and woke up in 1995 Windows 3.1—but with vaporwave sensibilities. That's what we built here: a fully functional MIDI player that looks like it belongs in a time capsule from a future that never happened.

The build unfolded across five distinct phases. First came the core Winamp layout—that iconic title bar, display area, controls, and a mesmerizing 24-bar visualizer that dances to the music. Then we integrated 22 MIDI tracks (15 actual Blank Banshee MIDImorphosis tracks plus 7 AI-generated compositions), generated 8 AI album covers dripping with vaporwave aesthetic using Ideogram, built a 4-skin theming system so you can switch vibes on the fly (Classic, Dolphin, Sailor Moon, Vintage), and topped it off with a persistent minified player widget that lives in the navbar.

What makes this special isn't just that it works—it's that every pixel screams authenticity. The frosted glass blur effects, the inset/outset beveled borders straight from Windows 3.1, the CRT glow, the sunset gradients... this isn't a music player, it's a portal. Click that lime-green 'Launch Music Player' button above and take it for a spin. Switch skins, browse the 22 tracks, watch the visualizer pulse. This is what nostalgia sounds like when it's been remixed by the future.
